result.markdown: --- title: Valentine's Day Spending order: 90 --- ## Setting up R Packages ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} library(tidyverse) library(mosaic) library(skimr) library(ggformula) library(ggprism) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ::: ## Introduction This dataset pertains to spending on gifts by various people for Valentine's Day. This was part of the TidyTuesday Project for February 2024! ## Read the Data ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} gifts_age <- readr::read_csv("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2024/2024-02-13/gifts_age.csv") glimpse(gifts_age) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Rows: 6 Columns: 9 $ Age "18-24", "25-34", "35-44", "45-54", "55-64", "65+" $ SpendingCelebrating 51, 40, 31, 19, 18, 13 $ Candy 70, 62, 58, 60, 50, 42 $ Flowers 50, 44, 41, 37, 32, 25 $ Jewelry 33, 34, 29, 20, 13, 8 $ GreetingCards 33, 33, 42, 42, 43, 44 $ EveningOut 41, 37, 30, 31, 29, 24 $ Clothing 33, 27, 26, 20, 19, 12 $ GiftCards 23, 19, 22, 23, 20, 20 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} # gifts_age %>% downloadthis::download_this( output_name = "Valentines_Day_Gifts_dataset", output_extension = ".csv", button_label = "Download data", button_type = "warning", has_icon = TRUE, icon = "fa fa-save" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html} ``` ::: ::: ## Data Dictionary ::: callout-note ### Quantitative Variables Write in. ::: ::: callout-note ### Qualitative Variables Write in. ::: ::: callout-note ### Observations Write in. ::: ## Analyse/Transform the Data ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ````{.cell-code} ```{{r}} #| label: data-preprocessing # # Write in your code here # to prepare this data as shown below # to generate the plot that follows # Change data to factors etc. # Set up Counts, histograms etc ``` ```` ::: ## Research Question ::: callout-note Write in!! Look at the Chart! ::: ## Plot the Data ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/plot-gifts-data-1.png){fig-align='center' width=2100} ::: ::: ## Task and Discussion - Complete the Data Dictionary. - Select and Transform the variables as shown. - Create the graphs shown and discuss the following questions: - Identify the type of charts - Identify the variables used for various geometrical aspects (x, y, fill...). Name the variables appropriately. - What research activity might have been carried out to obtain the data graphed here? Provide some details. - What pre-processing of the data was required to create the chart? - What might be the Hypothesis / Research Question, based on the Chart? - Write a 2-line story based on the chart, describing your inference/surprise.
